tools.httpserver
Class FileEditor

java.lang.Object
  tools.httpserver.FileEditor
All Implemented Interfaces:
HttpConstants
public class FileEditor
extends java.lang.Object
implements HttpConstants

Provides facilities to edit and save text files stored on disk
Replace following html tags in page:

  • <!-- comment --> \t replaced by server events (save, ...)
  • <!-- error --> \t replaced by server errors
  • %name% \t replaced by file name (without path)
  • <!--filename-->\t replaced by file name (with path)
  • <!--filecontent-->\t replaced by file content

set

public static java.lang.String set(java.lang.String content,
                                   java.lang.String filename)
Return content with "<!--filecontent-->" replaced by a textarea containing given file content

Parameters:
content - The html content to update
filename - The filename which content is inserted into textarea
Returns:
the modified html page

save

public static void save(java.lang.String filename,
                        java.lang.String htmlcontent,
                        User user)
Save provided content into given filename. Existing file with given name is deleted.

Parameters:
filename - the file name to use
htmlcontent - the content to save into file
user - User issuing the request

allowed

public static boolean allowed(HttpConstants.RIGHTS userrights,
                              HttpConstants.RIGHTS filerights)
Check if user rights are enough to manipulate file

Parameters:
userrights - User rights
filerights - File attached rights
Returns:
true if user is allowed to manipulate file
